name: Hotel Rossia (back view)
description:
Hand-printed colour photograph, 12"x8", edition of 10. 

OR there are 3 of the 5 editions of this photograph also still available at the large-scale size of 30"x40". Also hand-printed by the artist, these cost 900.00 Euros. 

This image part of the Trans Sibeiran Project / Moscow to Beijing from 2005-6, which has been shown at Kiasma Museum, Helsinki, Finland; The Other Gallery, Banff, Alberta, Canada; Globe Hub, Newcastle, UK; London Gallery West, University of Westminster, London; Frederico Seve, New York, USA and Center for Endless Progress, Berlin, Germany. Essentially I travelled on the trans siberian train from Moscow to Beijing in order to interact with fellow passengers through videoed interviews and the distribution of disposable cameras, in order to learn more about the cultures I was travelling through. 

This image is from a series of 14 selected to be shown alongside the video and photography of the participatory project. 

For more info about this project and other work please visit my website: http://www.ellyclarke.com.

Shipping prices charged at cost.

options.name: Hotel Rossia (back view) 12"x8", Edition of 10 - 250 Euros
Hotel Rossia (back view) 30"x40", Edition of 5 - 900 Euros

name: Net Curtain (Hotel Rossia)
description: Part of the Trans Siberian Project / Moscow to Beijing. Hand printed colour photograph, 12"x8", edition of 10. Also available in large-format, 30"x40"; edition of 5. This picture has been exhibited in Finland, USA, UK, Russia, Germany and Canada. Hotel Rossia was the hotel I stayed in before starting on the Trans Siberian journey. Six months after I stayed there it was demolished, to make way for something more up to date. This photograph was taken through the net curtain of the room I was in for the first 2 nights. The third night I was moved to a front-looking room, which, rather than 70s in style as this room was, was more 90s with brass bedside lights, pastel coloured linen but an amazing view of the River. To see pictures that illustrate all this please click here: and scroll to the right! For more information about this and other projects of mine please visit my website: http://www.ellyclarke.com The photograph, like all in this series, is taken with an analogue 35mm Leica M6 camera.

name: Lenin's Foot, Novosibirsk, September 2005
description:
Part of the Trans Siberian Project / Moscow to Beijing. This is one of the 14 large-scale photographs I printed during a residency at the Banff Centre in Canada, which accompanies all other project material: video documentation, photographs taken by the people I interviewed on the train, ephemera and a fund-raising strategy project. 

For more information please visit my website: http://www.ellyclarke.com. 

Shipping charged at cost.

description:
Part of Trans Siberian Project / Moscow to Beijing - major project from 2005-6 that has been exhibited at Kiasma Museum, Helsinki, Finland; The Banff Centre, Alberta, Canada; Globe Hub, Newcastle, UK; Museum of Fine Arts, Ekaterinburg & the National Centre of Contemporary Art, Moscow, Russia; Frederico Seve, New York, USA & Center for Endless Progress, Berlin, Germany. 

Hand printed colour photograph 30"x40". Edition of 5. 

For more information about my work and this project please visit my website: http://www.ellyclarke.com
